intro: Tsjeru-caniram pentandrum, commonly known as the five-finger plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive five-lobed leaves. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, with five petals. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
